Being 13 if that's not an option, just try all things in moderation. You can go for walks around your neighborhood, dance around your bedroom, use water filled milk jugs as weights to build muscle. You should do at least 30 min of cardio 3 times a week! <answer>



Relax, take it easy........and please stop doing that aneorexic buisness bacause that can be bad for you and it is certainly not help, as i will explain...

I have recently lost one stone, and it has taken about a month....this may seem long but trust me, losing weight is not a five minute thing......but the news gets better.....

You dont have to slave away at a bike or going running hours on end to lose weight, although that is one way of doing it...... all i have done is start cutting down on what i was eatting, big time, chocolate in moderation, cakes biscuits etc are watched carefully.

Another thing I did was to have a bit more get up and go about me......I live in south wales which has many mountains,,,,, i now see each one as a challenge or obsticle in my way to a new healthier me....get out, even if it is for a brisk walk it is burning carlories......

The third and final thing that I have changed is that I started drinking tea....green tea.......it is known for its weight loss properties and it is in nearly every weight loss product about....it may not taste very nice but it will help you lose weight even quicker...it is also very cheap.

The next step to take, if you doubt yourself......is a will power test....go to asda and buy some ready hot cooked chicken from the hot counter... take it home and remove every bit of chicken from the bone without eatting it.....not a single bit!



This is very difficult but if you complete the test successfully you have proved to yourself that you have to power, you have the key to success.

One last point.....dont starve yourself.....you body will react to being starved by storing even more fat to keep as energy reserves.....and dont give into weight loss products...they can be very bad for you and can have strange side effects.....



Remember......you have the power......you have the key to success...dont give in......have patience.........

Good luck,

Matt.



</answer>

hello. losing weight and how many kilometres you run, arent linked... you cant run a certain amount of kms to lose a certain amount of weight... also, understand that a "diet" doesnt mean you eat less... it means you eat less JUNK!

to lose weight = exercise to burn more calories than the amount you eat...

this doesnt mean you eat one meal a day and run for hours... it means you eat 5-7 SMALL and HEALTHY meals a day, and do about 45 minutes of walking or jogging in the morning. that should do it.

<answer>



5kg isn't so bad, you'll be able to do that easily!

I'd run every second day. You can mix it up a bit - 3km one day, 5km the next session.  Add some sprints when you can (short distances).  30 mins to 45 is a good amount of time. On the days you aren't running you could walk, cycle, swim.

Cut out the junk, drink water (not juice and fizzy drink), more fresh fruit and vegetables. You don't have to diet - just eat healthy.

A couple of times a week do some toning exercises to build muscle. There are some ideas here:  http://www.abc-of-fitness.com/info/fitne...

A kilo a week is pretty good going, you might lose it a little faster but try to take your time.



</answer>

First of all, just FYI, you two are at an age where peers are mean about weight, clothes, everything! I remember people in middle school being horrible to each other. I know that it would be easy for an adult to tell you that you are too young to worry about having a boyfriend, because I remember being a teen and it was important! Boys at that age are sooo shy too and totally afraid of rejection. They aren't going to ask her out if they don't know for sure that she is going to say yes. All of my friends in high school were on a 24/7 diet because we were so worried about boys. If she wants to go on a diet this is a fine age to do it. But guys will pay more attention to her if she is confident and out-going with them over her being a size two. My crush my freshman year of high school picked a "chubby" girl over me (who was anorexic and a size 4) because she was more friendly and confident with him. Tell her to be confident with herself and she will be fine!



</answer>

<answer from>



HappyCL
Member since: 10 August 2008
Total points: 223 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Energy Balance and Weight Management - Understanding energy balance is the key to losing weight or maintain weight successfully.

Calorie intake &gt; Calorie use ==&gt; Weight Gain

Calorie intake = Calorie use ==&gt; No change in body weight

Calorie intake &lt; Calorie use ==&gt; Weight loss

Losing weight does not mean avoiding food. Instead, eat less food that is high in fat and added sugar. Eat a variety of plant-based food like whole grains, fruit and vegetables. These food provide bulk and promote the feeling of fullness.

Eat regular meals and avoid skipping meals as it may lead to overeating at subsequent meals.

Move more - Exercise

Physical activity is an essential part of any effective weight loss programme. It helps burn calories and builds muscles.



Source(s):



http://thehappyhealth.com/updates/?p=19



</answer>

</answer from>



<answer>



You can switch to larger portions; instead of one piece of toast, have two. Heartier foods also help. Whole grain foods work well for this. General Mills cereal company recently came out with a big line of whole grain versions of their usuals (Lucky Charms, Cheerios, etc). Also, muscle weighs more than fat, and starting an exercise routine can cause water weight. If you have stomach problems or diarrhea, you could be dealing with a bigger problem. Also, if you're young (like 13 years old) you have a lot more growing to do, and most people grow into their figure, sometimes even becoming 'chunky'. There's a link I added to kidshealth, and even if you are over 18, it still has some nice tips. All of their articles are well written, and most by doctors.



Source(s):



http://www.ivillage.co.uk/dietandfitness...
http://kidshealth.org/teen/nutrition/wei...



</answer>

<answer>



I you need to gain weight.  Any way you do it is healthy.  Don't listen to the diet crazed society we live in that claims fat and carbs are bad.  Most Americans are overweight, that's why high cal and fatty foods are "bad for you." To gain weight you just need to up your calorie intake and limit exercise.  You don't need to lift weights unless you want to be a body builder.  As a recovering anorexic I feel your pain.  It's hard to gain weight.  You probably get full too quickly right? Here's some high cal foods you can try.

Drink These
-ensure plus or boost plus
-whole milk
-milkshakes
-fruit juice and nectars
-smoothies

Add these to Drinks
-whey or soy protein powder
-carnation instant breakfast
-nonfat dried milk

Add in these snacks
-ice cream
-fage total (the full fat kind)
-bagels and cream cheese
-muffins
-cake, brownies, cookies
-oatmeal (made with milk and add a couple bananas to it)
-peanut butter banana and honey on a bagel or thick bread
-dried fruit



Add these to foods you already eat
-full fat salad dressings or olive oil
-mayonnaise
-butter
-sour cream
-creamy pasta sauces like Alfredo
-potatoes
-corn
-peas
-avocados
-flax seeds
-any kind of beans
-granola
-cheese (as long as it's not lowfat)
-bologna, salami, and other fatty deli meats
-nuts and peanut butter
-bananas



</answer>

Hello
First, I understand where you're coming from. My name is Mary and I am posting this because I know what it’s like to be over weight and feel your life spiraling out of control. I was almost 360 pounds, struggling with my health and looking for a way out. Seriously, I would have done almost anything to make a change in my life. And I did, with very little success. Pills, therapy, even working out were getting me nowhere.

No matter what I tried I never really saw a change because I could not stop my love of eating. It’s so hard for people to understand when they haven’t faced this struggle. Everyone just says that you have to will power. But if you are like me, you know there is much more to it.

I realized I was holding my life in my hands and I made the decision to find a way out of my self-inflicted nightmare. After years of struggle and countless nights studying the ins and outs of exercise science I finally stumbled onto a Fat Loss program that caused me to lose 143 pounds and still allowed me to enjoy the foods I love. This is nothing like what you have done before. Fat Loss program changed my life and I could not believe just how easy it was.

I want you to discover the key that turned my life around.

For more information please visit: 
http://www.honestweightlossreview.com

Good Luck,
-Mary

If you don't eat  wheat  then you don't eat all those sticky, fatty goey cakes, you don't  eat  junk  food,  and  you don't eat biscuits. But your diet is still  balanced. It costs nothing, and you do not have to calculate points or
to buy special meals or plans.

Dr Frank
Member since: 03 February 2007
Total points: 81406 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Women's Health

Other - Diseases



</answer from>



<answer>



The problem with your question is that if you look in "search for questions" it comes up 30 times every day. I have had some criticism for repeatedly using the same answer, but since I am happy with my answer, and the questions are the same, I don't see the issue with recycling the same answer.

In practise for problems that came up on a regular basis we tended to use patient leaflets to avoid having to repeat ourselves this seemed a sensible use of resources. What follows is thus in effect me information leaflet.

Weight loss and fitness is always a long term commitment and never a quick fix. If you really want to reduce your weight a bit, this is a complex regime, that should help, I would get a pencil to write it down, in case you forget any of the intricate details.

Currently only using the criteria 'lose weight' there are 9,151 questions and answers on Answers already. Mis-spell it as 'loose weight' and you get another 2,554! 'Weight loss' will add another 1,839. 'Too fat ' 15,167 and 'overweight' 2,630 and 'over weight' 25,588!!!!!.

'Diet Pills' gives 593, Hoodia 194, 'pink patch' 116, 'Xenical' 89 'Reductil' 75, 'Slim fast' 213 (and Slimfast 69 ), lipotrim 44 and 'orlistat' 39 . Do you spot a pattern here? OMG that is over 38,000 questions with the same basic theme, wanting to lose weight!

Here comes the only answer, no tricks, no pills, no short cuts, If you really want to lose weight, loose weight, not be too fat or overweight, follow these instructions carefully:-

1) Eat less
2) Take regular vigorous exercise



Repeat 1+2 forever



Source(s):



GP for more years than I care to remember



</answer>

<question from>



little miss sunshine
Member since: 31 July 2008
Total points: 125 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How do i get my bf to start making healthier choices?



Ok my bf is 22, at least 140kg (even though he insists he is only 115kg) and 6ft tall. I know he is not 115kg cos i am 96kg at the moment due to being 8 months pregnant and he is much bigger than me! He doesn't have the healthiest diet (hardly eats any fruit or veg)and doesn't do ANY excercise. Even when i go for a short walk he won't come with me because he is too tired.



He has said that he knows he needs to lose weight and he wants too- he just doesnt want to make any changes for this to happen. I've tried making healthier meals but he wont eat the vegies.



I'm out of ideas and running out of energy to keep encouraging him to try.  i'm even getting to the stage where i'm not physically attracted to him anymore.  But more than anything want him to be there later in life for our children.



Any ideas?



</question>



<additional details>



When we first met he was probably 115 kgs but it's obvious that he has put on substancial amount of weight since then- perhaps getting too comfortable with the relationship.



Dont get me wrong i still love him with all my heart and i am worried about him thats the only reason i am wanting him to be healthier.  And i'm not saying i'm perfect either i know i'm over weight too- but at this stage in my pregnancy i'm doing as much as i can including eating well!



</additional details>



<answer from>



kimba_le...
Member since: 21 November 2007
Total points: 4587 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



It's all very well for people to say 'dont nag!' but the fact is your bf is quite overweight which means there are health risks involved and you're obviously concerned. Being overweight can lead to high blood pressure, diabetes, and in severe cases it can cause a heart attack.

I understand this must be difficult and awkward for you. My thought is to sit him down and explain this to him. Explain that you absolutely love and adore him, but you're concerned about his health and eating habits, and you hate seeing him unfit because it affects his quality of life and will later affect his ability to be the best father he can be if he continues on the road he's going.

Be supportive of him and encouraging, and write down a list of meals that you (and him- he needs to get involved too. It shouldn't be you doing all the work!) will make every night for dinner. The best advice I can give you is to make eating a planned activity. If all the food is prepared and ready to go he is less likely to go look for snacks. An excellent cookbook is Cook Yourself Thin, which has the yummiest foods such as lasagne, chocolate cake, etc in it except *healthy* versions. I strongly advise you get this book because we used it in my family and no-one could tell the difference, but they were eating 10 times healthier and were sneakily getting serves of fruits and vegies without knowing ;-)

Also make going for walks a time for both of you. Say its important to you that he becomes involved. Even a 20 minute walk per day (if you can manage due to your pregnancy!) If you can do it at 8 months, he can do it at 0 months lol!

Good luck and I hope some of this helps. Just stay positive, lead by example, and encourage him, because weight can be a sensitive issue. Just reassure him you love him, but want to see him healthier so you can lead a long and happy life together.
xo



</answer>



<asker's comment>

I love the sound of that book. I'll definately get it! Thanks again for your understanding



</asker's comment>

<question from>



=))AnnA=...
Member since: 24 March 2006
Total points: 134 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Shall I gain the weight if I stop training?



So I have a school holidays and in the previous month, in July I was training everyday in the morning for 30 minutes and in addition to this every evening for 45 minutes. Now I've got no time to stand up early in the morning and get back to the training. I'm eating less than 1600 calories and burning more than 2000 calories. I want to lose 3 kilos in 1 month, so that I didn't harm my health condition. How can I deal with this problem? Shall I gain if I stop training in the morning?



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



You won't gain if you keep your calories in check. If you're working out less than you used to now, you are going to require fewer calories.



</answer>

<question from>

<answer>



Cut down your eating until your stomach actually hurts all day. Then ride an elliptical or run for a good 30 minutes. I'm not kidding about the eating part, if your stomach hurts, it wants food that you normally give it. Bribing  it of food for most of the day will cause your stomach to shrink, thus you eat less without even trying.



</answer>



<answer from>



straight...
Member since: 08 November 2007
Total points: 11121 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Diet & Fitness



</answer from>



<answer>



When we want to get rid of body fat, there is no way to specifically burn fat from one part of the body. Doing sit ups won't burn the fat that is covering your abs and doing tricep extensions won't get rid of the fat that is covering your triceps. The only thing you can do is lose weight all around and eventually the problem area will also improve. The way to burn fat is through a calorie restricted diet in conjunction with an exercise routine that will burn calories. Activities that burn calories include running, biking, swimming and other high intensity activities.

Guide to Reducing Body Fat - http://straighthealth.com/pages/guides/r...



</answer>

<answer>



You need to eat healthy all day long.  Start with breakfast.  Eat several small meals throughout the day to reset your metabolism.  You need to eat from all food groups and eliminate junk food from your diet.
You also need to get moving.  Start a complete exercise program of stretching, strengthening, and cardiovascular exercises.  And if you have trouble staying motivated, a fitness partner can be a great motivator for your lifestyle change. 
For more information, visit the website.

</answer from>



<answer>



Body parts specific exercises, you can find them in the library and on the Internet.

When you loose weight you loose all over evenly but you loose more in the area that you work at.
****
Tips for Loosing Weight
By
minootoo

You must count calories and at least in initial stages write down what you are going to eat and when then stay on that list. Your total calories for the week must not exceed, 1500 x 7 = 10,500 calories this will give you leave way to indulge at special occasions like wedding and parties, but you must write down what you eat and account for the calories latter and adjust the total intake next week.

Please read my article on this subject and follow them.
While at it build your body too, while reducing by doing body parts specific exercises.

If you are not too old, then best way to reduce your weight is to increase your height.

Vegetarians have a big advantage, in loosing weight, it cost less and they can satisfy the hunger more easily, some vegetables have only a few calories per pound, so they can fill themselves up with it before enjoying each meal, and never go hungry.



Most people should take one a day water soluble multi-vitamins when on this program; they can be purchased at the pharmacy near you.

http://www.scientificpsychic.com/fitness...

http://www.halls.md/ideal-weight/body.ht...

http://www.halls.md/body-mass-index/bmi....

http://search.yahoo.com/search?ei=utf-8&...
********
Increasing the Height 
By 
minootoo

In rare cases, you can increase the height up to age 30.

Cycling is good exercise and fun too.

You need to adjust the seat so that when you paddle from seating position you will actually stretch your legs, it is a difficult position but doable. For safety you need to be on track and not in traffic, safety first.

The FEW things I did at least helped me.

Swimming.



Not just playing in water, but serious laps type swimming, do not try to beat the clock but steady full strokes swimming. Remember slow and steady wins the race.

Stretching exercises on floor.

Find them on line.

Chin ups.

Full stretch type.

Swinging from a rope.

Full stretch climbing.

In other words do things that require stretching.
STRETCH-STRETCH-STRETCH-STRETCH

PS

In the morning after good night sleep every one is about 1/2 inch to 1 inch taller. This is because the soft tissue between the bones recovers during the time when there is no weight on them.

Older people loose height due to bone loss. I was 5', 7'' I am only 5', 5".

Issue of Genes:



You know only the active genes but genes can stay dormant for generations.

I believe that every one has some tall height genes, dormant or active; I again believe that certain exercises can activate those.

Again Swimming:



You will start out with half a lap and build up day by day, half a lap at a time. Then you will swim non stop for 1/2 an hour.

The speed is not important but you must use various strokes and do them correctly, completely, slowly and perfectly. This way you will have full stretch, and its benefit.

Eating healthy foods and taking rest as specially sleeping soundly at night is very important. Most people need 8 hours of good sound sleep per night, some need more and few get by with 4 hours only.

In the mean time use high hills and take advantage of hair-do, wardrobe can do wonders too; vertical striped clothing can create a taller look for most people.

Hormones:

Under strict supervision of a doctor they do wonders but the side effects are delayed and unpredictable so doctors do not like to use them.

Surgical Procedures:

There are surgical procedures but most doctors will not do them till the person is 30 years or so. They also have to be very short.
********
Life Style Change Program for Loosing Weight
By
minootoo

Who needs to loose weight?

Answer is simply not every one, only the over weight person.

Who is over weight?

This is simple, it is easy to find out and it is available on line, it is call Body Mass Index, and calculations are simple. According to this calculation if you find your self say only 10 pounds more, you may not be over weight. Remember every one is slightly different and you can just watch it, on your own and not let it get out of hand.

What is the reason for being over weight?

This is also simple, have doctor check you out for any physical or hormonal abnormalities. The doctor should be advising you of your ideal weight even though you have already figured out the ideal weight and you are seen a doctor because your weight is not where it should be according to BMI.

Basic understanding of loosing weight.

Every one uses calories at all time. There may be some exceptions to this rule, for most of us; the rate of use, even when we are resting, we use 65 calories per hour minimum. This comes to1560 calories per day. The actual range is between 65 and 100 calories per hour. This is consistent with heart rate of 60 to 80 bits per minute.

Simply put any person eating only say 1500 calories a day, and moderately active, will not put on any additional weight. At this level of calories consumption the person should loose some weight over long haul, depending on the individual rate of metabolism.

What is a healthy weight loss?

When one tries to loose weight, one should loose excess fat; there should be a healthy loss of weight. Loosing muscles tissue is unhealthy.

How much is one pound of body fat?

One pound of body fat weight is approximately same as one pound of butter. If you look at a one pound package of butter, you will see it contains between 3200 to 3600 calories. This means that each time a person burns 3600 more calories then what the person takes in, the person will loose one pound.

How many pounds should a person loose in a month?

Any one that is trying to trim down can figure out how long it took to put on the excess pounds. The fact is; it did not happen over night. It usually creeps up, but the person realizes one day suddenly.

This is why a person should not be in a hurry to loose weight. The person should start at once but go slowly. Do not wait for New Year.

Taking above in to consideration a person should not loose more then 2 pounds per month. If a person looses any thing more then that, chances are that the person will not be able to maintain the weight loss. It will take extra efforts to loose and it will take extra efforts to keep it off. Remember slow and steady wins the race.



When an overweight person should start loosing weight?

At once. The person should not be in a hurry to loose weight. The person should start at once but go slowly. Again do not wait for New Year.

How does body react to weight lose?

Any time there is depletion of fat beyond certain level, the body reacts by slowing down metabolism, so that it can build up fat. If the body is use to say 2000 calories per day and detects only 1500 calories per day for considerable length of time it reacts to the situation by reducing the rate of metabolism. When this happens one need to help body by increasing activity. Usually takes about four weeks for body to react.

What is the relationship between body and body fat?

Under ideal condition fat act as a reserved energy source for our body. Certain level of fat is good for healthy living and even may save our life in certain life threatening situations. Every one should have minimum required level of fat on their body.

What if there is no weight loss at 1500 calories in take level?

This is a rear occurrence. Do not panic. The body has slowed down the metabolism to such a great extent that you must help it. The only way to help is to increase activities, this means you have to exercise. You do not need to join Gym but you can go on an an half an hour walk every day or batter still engage in a power walk for same duration. Power walk burns 250 calories per mile and walk burns 100 calories per mile approximately.

What is the importance of body fat for a female?

Females require little more body fat then men. In the absence of certain required level of body fat, females are not able to function properly; in particular they may not be able to conceive. You can find lot more about this on internet.

At 1500 calories intake per day what one must drink and eat?

Drink

One gallon of liquids most of witch should be in the form of water (zero calories).
Calories should be accounted for all other liquids.

Why water?

Water is a universal solvent, means it dissolves almost every thing at least in very minute quantities. This helps purification of body.

Eat

What should be your proportionate in take of fat, Proteins and Complex Carbohydrates?

This depends on what your need are.

1. Need to reduce fat.

Fat: 10 percent of 1500 calorie per day = 150 calories.
Complex Carbohydrates: 30 percent of 1500 calories per day = 450 calories.
Proteins: 60 percent of 1500 calories per day = 900 calories.

2. Need more energy.

Fat: 10 percent of 1500 calorie per day = 150 calories.
Complex Carbohydrates: 40 percent of 1500 calories per day = 450 calories.
Proteins: 50 percent of 1500 calories per day = 750 calories.

3. Need to reduce weight only.

Fat: 25 percent of 1500 calorie per day = 375 calories.
Complex Carbohydrates: 25 percent of 1500 calories per day = 375 calories.
Proteins: 50 percent of 1500 calories per day = 750 calories.

4. Need to increase muscles bulk, but still reduce weight.

Fat: 10 percent of 1500 calorie per day = 150 calories.
Complex Carbohydrates: 15 percent of 1500 calories per day = 225 calories.
Proteins: 75 percent of 1500 calories per day = 1125 calories.
Exercise the muscles you want to develop, you can find right exercise on line, recommend use of light weights.

Foot note: To take fat is so important, while reduc



</answer>

<answer from>



Dr Frank
Member since: 03 February 2007
Total points: 83189 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Women's Health



Diet & Fitness



Other - Diseases



</answer from>



<answer>



The problem with your question is that if you look in "search for questions" it comes up 30 times every day. I have had some criticism for repeatedly using the same answer, but since I am happy with my answer, and the questions are the same, I don't see the issue with recycling the same answer.

In practise for problems that came up on a regular basis we tended to use patient leaflets to avoid having to repeat ourselves this seemed a sensible use of resources. What follows is thus in effect me information leaflet.

Weight loss and fitness is always a long term commitment and never a quick fix. If you really want to reduce your weight a bit, this is a complex regime, that should help, I would get a pencil to write it down, in case you forget any of the intricate details.

Currently only using the criteria 'lose weight' there are 9,419 questions and answers on Answers already. Mis-spell it as 'loose weight' and you get another 2,633! 'Weight loss' will add another 1,883. 'Too fat ' 15,515 and 'overweight' 2,692 and 'over weight' 26,269!!!!!.

'Diet Pills' gives 607, Green tea 482, Hoodia 195, 'pink patch' 119, 'Xenical' 91 'Reductil' 78, 'Slim fast' 215 (and Slimfast 69 ), lipotrim 44 and 'orlistat' 40 . Do you spot a pattern here? OMG that is 60,000 questions with the same basic theme, wanting to lose weight!

Here comes the only answer, no tricks, no pills, no short cuts, If you really want to lose weight, loose weight, not be too fat or overweight, follow these instructions carefully:-

1) Eat less
2) Take regular vigorous exercise

Repeat 1 + 2 forever



Source(s):



GP for more years than I care to remember



</answer>



<answer from>



Transistor Jon
Member since: 18 August 2008
Total points: 133 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Obesity has become a major health problem around the world. Many companies have brought diet pills, medicines, powders and weight-loss belts in the market. Though these products claim to aid weight-loss, the weight reduction is temporary. Besides, the pills and powders can adversely affect your health. Here we offer you some tips to reduce weight successfully, without any negative health effects.

1 Reduce fat intake: 
2 Reduce intake of sugar:
3 Decrease alcohol consumption: 
4 Stay away from processed, fast and junk foods since they are laden with fat and sugar. 
5 Reduce quantity of food without going hungry:
6 Adopt regular eating habits:
7 Raise the amount of physical activity:
8 Learn a new hobby or interest: 
9 Improve your metabolism by eating natural foods: 
10 Control your appetite: 
More information the link: http://search.yahoo.com/search;_ylt=A0oG...



</answer>



<answer from>



John Smiley
Member since: 26 May 2007
Total points: 2444 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is not possible to spot reduce fat in just one part of your body, like your stomach. In order to lose stomach fat you will need to lose the fat all over your body.

In short you may need to start:

1) Eating healthier, this means:

Eat smaller meals
Eat more meals a day
Don’t starve yourself
Eat more vegetables and fruit
Drink more water
Less sugars and empty calories (less soft drinks, cakes, cookies)
Switch to whole wheat versions of your bread and pasta, brown rice instead of white rice

2) Exercising:

Forget crunches, crunches work your ab muscles but they don't burn enough calories to lose belly fat, if you do hundreds of crunches daily you will have great abs but you wont see them under your belly fat.
Prefer full body exercises they burn the most calories and increase you metabolism for a few hours after your workout.
Get a training partner or a fitness trainer, a very worthwhile investment - of the money you save on junk food for example =)

Try also to reduce stress and get enough sleep. Both of these are related to weight gain and emotional eating.

For more try: http://www.flatstomachtips.com

I wish you all the best,
John



</answer>

<answer>



I wish I could to give a short and comprehensive answer to this question. But I believe it´s impossible.
Metabolism is so different with each individual that there can´t be general rules how to influence it.

You may need to clean the body from toxins first, then adopt new diet and new eating habits. Perhaps a hole new approach to food/beverage. 
Metabolism (exchange of chemical materials within an organism) is there to "keep you alive and healthy" so to say.



In shortest, try to use natural food (avoid pre-fabricated food), good fat sources (olive oil and butter), sugar free beverage, A LOTS OF FRUITS, eat smaller amounts of food and keep moving (avoid long sitting). Good long walk is basically enough if you have no time for sports.



</answer>

<answer>



The problem with your question is that if you look in "search for questions" it comes up 30 times every day. I have had some criticism for repeatedly using the same answer, but since I am happy with my answer, and the questions are the same, I don't see the issue with recycling the same answer.

In practise for problems that came up on a regular basis we tended to use patient leaflets to avoid having to repeat ourselves this seemed a sensible use of resources. What follows is thus in effect me information leaflet.

Weight loss and fitness is always a long term commitment and never a quick fix. If you really want to reduce your weight a bit, this is a complex regime, that should help, I would get a pencil to write it down, in case you forget any of the intricate details.

Currently only using the criteria 'lose weight' there are 9,419 questions and answers on Answers already. Mis-spell it as 'loose weight' and you get another 2,633! 'Weight loss' will add another 1,883. 'Too fat ' 15,515 and 'overweight' 2,692 and 'over weight' 26,269!!!!!.

'Diet Pills' gives 607, Green tea 482, Hoodia 195, 'pink patch' 119, 'Xenical' 91 'Reductil' 78, 'Slim fast' 215 (and Slimfast 69 ), lipotrim 44 and 'orlistat' 40 . Do you spot a pattern here? OMG that is 60,000 questions with the same basic theme, wanting to lose weight!

Here comes the only answer, no tricks, no pills, no short cuts, If you really want to lose weight, loose weight, not be too fat or overweight, follow these instructions carefully:-

1) Eat less
2) Take regular vigorous exercise

Repeat 1 + 2 forever



Source(s):



GP for more years than I care to remember



</answer>

</answer from>



<answer>



You shouldn't be doing more than 20 reps, you need more weight no matter what you are going for. Use a heavier weight so that your muscle gives out after 15-20 reps. wait 30 seconds between sets and do 3-5 sets.
Also, the concept of more reps less weight for toning and more weight less reps for mass building has been proven to be wrong. After some studies, they found that less weight more reps builds endurance, not toning and that more weight less reps build strength not mass. However, they have now found that to also be inaccurate. They have now found that what truly build the muscle is your mind. You have to focus and concentrate on the muscle as you do it. Do slow controlled reps looking in the mirror and at your muscle and imagine it building the way you want it to. Feel the muscle tissue growing and even after your work out spend some time visualizing the muscle tissues repairing the micro rips your workout created. 
Hope this helps.
Peace.



</answer>



<answer from>



amp; co
Member since: 01 May 2008
Total points: 466 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I agree with ThatDUDE although there are the alternatives. You can also try the Priest Twists or the Bishop Twizzle. And then do a nice cool down with Pope Clenching.



Source(s):



Religious Jims & co



</answer>

<question>

<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



First off the worlds idea of fat has gotten out of hand. I say exercise but don't concentrate on loosing weight! Concentrate on being healthy and fit. I was 130 lbs at your age and was not fat. I had lots of muscle and was very fit! I also was a size 12. Funny how back then it was considered fit and now I see tones of sites saying if your size 12 and above your fat! It also matter what your height is? You said you are 5'10" and 140 lbs. Just put it this way a girl my height at 5'4" should way between 120 and 140lbs. At your height it gives you more room to weigh a little more and still not be fat. Check out these sites on weights, heights and sizes!  If 140 is fat for you then gosh I was a junk at 5'4". however I know that's not to be true! I was very fit and was even a Letterman on the swim team! Check out these sites to help you and don't stress it to much . Just be healthy!

http://www.nhlbisupport.com/bmi/

http://www.halls.md/body-mass-index/bmi....

http://www.healthchecksystems.com/height...

http://www.dietbites.com/Diet-Muse/20.ht...

http://www.docshop.com/2007/12/15/height...



P.S. I went ahead and calculated your BMI and you are in a normal to average range! That is exactly where you want to be! Also your height index to weight is right where it should be too. Any skinnier and you'd be a skeleton at your height! Like I said exercise to be healthy and gain muscle not to lose weight. Also don't freak out if you gain a few pounds because muscle ways more than fat! Good luck!

<answer>



It depends on how much you lost, but that definitely could happen. It typically happens when you've had major weight loss.

<answer>



Define bad food?

My recommendations.

Start the day with a large breakfast.

Fruit Juice a bowl of cereal or muesli  and use yogurt instead of milk with fruit or



fruit juice two slices  brown or wholemeal toast with honey or the sort of jam or fruit conserve that should have visible bits of fruit and hence fiber in it.

for a weekend treat buy croissants or have pikelets or  crumpets or something. Real butter will not hurt you.



Morning snack fruit or fruit juice



when you get sick of fruit and need a treat  small pastry or cake or muffin if its made with real butter and fruit or is middle to low gi



Lunch 
Anything high protein and low fat ideally with some salad greens.

If you're fed up with salad try leaves of Englsih spinach with some chutney for flavor. For protein you could use any leftover sliced meat or buy sliced meat from the nearest deli

you could buy a whole cooked chicken if you can afford one and that will give you a weeks supply of meat for lunch and evening meals and other things added

Evening meal protein pasta steamed or stirfried vegies 
roast vegies or meat if low fat and cooked with olive or vegie oil

desert something with fruit ! only one portion

evening or study homework snack.

hot chocolate or milo lower fat than a solid bar

A muffin or one biscuit

if you need to stay awake to study or you're out taking a long run or walk for energy a SMALL chocolate bar or portion is okay IF its REAL dark 70% cocoa theobromn eis good for the brain

In other words eat three times eat sensiblely and mix protein carbos and vegies and fruit with some diary



If you have a dog alternate running with a slow long walk with the dog and get a book showing the nearest scenic walks !

WATER WATER WATER



If you get the urge for fuzzy drinks drink water instead

A occassional "soft" drink in summer to dehydrate is okay?

Try mixing real ginger ale or beer the sort that has bits of ginger in it with diluted fruit juice. Mix this together and put it in a small plastic bottle. Leave some room at the top. Put the bottle in the freezer overnight. Voilia as it melts you have a slurpie smoothie thingy thats healthy to hit the spot!



</answer>

<answer from>



girl_101

</answer from>



<answer>



first off you should be doing 45 minutes of cardio a day(anything that keeps the heartbeat up - skipping, running, jogging, walking fast, etc) and 15 minutes of strength training to speed up your metabolism

make sure you are also having 8 glasses of cold water a day - the colder it is the better because your body has to warm it down to room temperature and to do that it uses the fat from your body... Eat 4-6 small meals a day every 2-3 hours to keep your metabolism up also and dont eat before 4 hours of going to bed.

MEAL PLAN:

Breakfast: Oatmeal with skim milk OR museli mixed with low-fat yogurt & have some fruit with your breakfast too (kiwi, strawberries, etc)

snack: small apple

lunch: chicken salad or a deli-sandwich (ham, tomato, lettuce, NO cheese on wholemeal bread)..



snack: rice crackers or low-fat cracker biscuits OR 2 tsp cottage cheese

Dinner: soup & vegies, skinless chicken (grilled) with vegies or some fish with vegies.

Snack (optional): low-fat yogurt or fruit



Also every now and again you can have a small portion of icecreams or muffins or cupcakes etc.. just dont go overboard!



</answer>

Guru of MSG

<answer>



Avoid what's known as "processed free glutamate", a neurotoxic flavor enhancer that's both harmful and addictive. You won't be able to know in which foods to find it unless you know the ingredients and foods that contain it. MSG is just one of those many ingredients. FYI, consumption of processed free glutamate has been linked to Obesity, Migranes, Headaches, Learning Disabilities, Sleep Disorders and many more health problems that the health industry doesn't want you to know so that all those food/beverage corporations will make big $$ as well as your doctors.



The FDA claims that all glutamate (including processed free glutamate) is generally safe, but then why do independent studies prove that it's a toxic? Also, you'll see sodium and fat measured on labels even if there's none at all, but you won't see glutamate labeled and measured even though the food/beverage contains it.



Yes, even some whole wheat breads contain that neurotoxin through the use of malted barley flour and yeast extract.

Check out http://www.msgtruth.com/avoid.htm for the complete list of ingredients/foods to avoid.
And check out http://www.msgmyth.com for more information about how harmful and addictive glutamate consumption can be to your health!

FYI, just by avoiding all those foods with hidden "processed free glutamate", I've lost at least 20 pound in 5 months.

If you stick to that kind of a truly smart diet, you'll not only save a lot of money (by being less hungry and going to the doctor less), but also become healthier!



Source(s):



http://www.msgmyth.com and  http://www.msgtruth.com/avoid.htm



</answer>

<answer>



It is impossible to do in a week. But with a few minor changes you could possibly see a difference in a few weeks.



1. Most peoples problem are sodas and junk food. (Pepsi and potato chips are my weakness.) But if you limit yourself to one 12 ounce can of soda a day (every other day is better) and skip the junk by substituting a healthy snack. Fruit is sweet and healthy. And a type of nut, like peanuts, are salty but still very good for you. 
2. Do simple things at first like parking farther away and walking to a store or taking the stairs instead of the elevator.  My best bud an I go to our local mall to walk on Saturday mornings. We are not shoppers but the mall makes an excellent, cool environment to exercise. 
3. Jogging, running, and swimming laps are great ways to slim down and get more healthy. Also, though it might sound fruity, in an aerobic class you can burn up to 500 calories in just one session.



Hope this helped. Check out my source websites. Good luck!

<answer>



There is no "true way" to lose weight. I can't believe the sources that people feed into these days. It's simply a matter of cutting your caloric intake and burning more calories through daily exercise. Whether you take it to an extreme case is your personal choice and risk. Anyone who says it's not healthy is a hypocrite, because I'm sure it's just as unhealthy as when they eat fast food, sip on sodas, and snack on candies, so hush up and please keep to yourself.



As for your question, you can lose about 5-7 pounds of water weight by doing some jogging for an hour and a half or so. Do this for a week and cut back on your calories and you'll see results. I'm not saying you won't feel exhausted and depleted, I'm simply giving you the information you want without criticism. I've fluctuated through many body weights and I know how it feels and what it takes to get there, whether it's the "healthy" way or the "unhealthy" way.



Source(s):



Fitness Student, Distance Runner



</answer>

<answer>



The thing you need to know is that there are no shortcuts.

<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



The most common cause of obesity is poor diet and/or eating habits and a lack of exercise.  Other factors that can lead to obesity include glandular malfunctions, diabetes, hypoglycemia, emotional tension, boredom, and a simple love of food.  Obesity has also been linked to food sensitivities and/or allergies.  Food your body cannot use or that is a poison to your system is stored in the tissues and causes water retention.  Ironically, poor nutrition may be an important factor in obesity.  When there is inadequate intake of certain essential nutrients, fat is not easily or adequately burned and can accumulate in the body.



The amount of calories required varies from person to person. There is no need to worry about the amount of calories you consume as about eating the proper foods.  Rotate your foods, and be sure to eat a variety of foods.  Eat meals that consist of a balance of proteins, complex carbohydrates, and some fat.  Proteins can increase your metabolic rate by as much as 30%, and help to balance the release of insulin by prompting secretion of the pancreatic hormone glucagons.  Protein-induced glucagons, mobilizes fats from the tissues in which it is stored, thus aiding in weight loss.  By eating balanced meals you get more steady blood sugar levels and the ability to burn stored body fat for long-term weight loss.  Eat mainly plant proteins, such as nut, seeds, and grains.

Eat fresh fruits and an abundance of raw vegetables.  Have one meal each day that consists entirely of vegetables and fruits.  Use more low calorie vegetables such as broccoli, cabbage, carrots, cauliflower, celery, cucumbers, green beans, kale, lettuce, onions, radishes, spinach, and turnips.  Eat more of the low calorie, low-carbohydrate fruits including,  apples, cantaloupe, grapefruit, strawberries, and watermelon.

Eat foods raw where possible.  Drink 8 – 10 glasses of water each day.  Also include home made fruit juices and vegetable juices in your diet.  Eat a wide variety of fruits and vegetables - at least all kinds that you can get your hands on.  Just eat more of the low cal., low carb ones. Eat at least 3 times per day, your breakfast being the largest and very nutritious.  And do not forget to take exercise.



Example of meals

Breakfast:- a complex carbohydrate (yam, green banana, potato, etc.), steamed green leafy vegetable, meat or fresh, fruits, mixed with nuts, and seeds.

Mid Afternoon meal:- of meat or fish, 1 or 2 complex carbohydrate (eg. yam, potatoes, pumpkin etc), a mixture of raw vegetables, (eg. lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, broccoli, yellow or red sweet pepper, shredded carrots), varied mixture of steam vegetables (eg a leafy vegetable and/or string beans, or a vegetable salad)

If you'd like to add drink - preferably home made fruit or vegetable juice.

Evening Meal:- A mixture of different fruits with nuts and seeds.  Or a mixture of different raw vegetables with nuts, seeds, and cheese.

The above examples are just guidelines that you may follow.  You should vary your meals.



</answer>

<answer>



it takes a whole lot of commitment and you have to ask yourself how badly you want to lose weight.
start by trying an all water diet first, see how much you can handle at once. don't drink any sugary drinks like soda or even some juices.
water is the healthiest and most natural drink there is. 
do that for about a week or week and a half and when you can achieve that, take the next step

cut down on junk foods. eat like a cross country runner. instead of having a snack with your lunch, try eating a larger lunch. for ex: put more ham or turkey in your sandwich so that it'll fill you up better. that way, you won't need the snacks to go along with it. when you do need a snack, eat rice cakes and carrot sticks.



exercising is also key. don't force yourself to do so much at once. its important to adjust to the workload slowly so you can lose weight in a healthier way. you can try going to some gym but running on your own is a great way to get excersise. make sure you drink lots of water, stretch and if you think you can handle it, do 5 sets of 50 crunches, cherry pickers, or obliques. this will strengthen your stomach muscles and sculp off that fat. don't run just until you feel tired. that's when you actually start burning that fat. start off with at least a mile a day and when that gets easier, go for 4-6.



believe in yourself. don't ever think that there's no way you'll be able to do this. you just need to push yourself and put in hard work. i know it's easy to say but believe me, i know.

good luck. hopes this helps :D

<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



There is no fast way to lose weight. If you're looking for a healthy way to lose significant weight in a month, you're not gonna find one. It's best to stick the the obvious with diet and exercise, and raise your metabolism rate. Your metabolism is the rate at which you burn calories. It's the best way if you want to lose weight in a steady, healthy pace.

1. Eat small frequent meals: Having 4 to 6 small healthy meals a day instead of eating 3 big meals a day is a better way to stop going into 'starvation mode.' In 'starvation mode' your body will hold on to the calories it has until your next meal. Don't extend the time between meals.

2. Drink water. Remember the "8 by 8" rule? (drink eight 8-ounce glasses of water per day) This isn't necessarily healthy. The amount of water you drink each day depends on your age, height, and activity level. Divide your weight by two, this is the amount of ounces of water you'll need each day to maintain a healthy weight. &lt;--That's a smart way to do it ;)

Tips to increase your water intake:
- Carry a bottle or container of water where ever you go, you'll get used to drinking water at hand, whenever you feel a bit thirsty.
- Keep a glass of water next to you on your computer desk if you spend a long time on the computer. (like I do)
- If you dislike the taste of water, you can always add some lemon or flavoring to your drink. Just avoid dissolvants high in sugar.

3. Aerobic Exercise is the best way to lose weight and gain muscle quickly. This is simple! Aerobic exercise can be something like running, riding your bike, or going up a flight of stairs. Working out for only a half hour, 3 times a week is the recommended amount of exercise you should have.



This is hard, and will take commitment. Ask a friend to try out this with you, this can help a lot. You won't feel alone and can someone to lean on when you feel like you need to give up. Try your best, and I hope you the best of luck!

Here:
http://www.wikihow.com/Lose-Weight
http://www.wikihow.com/Increase-Your-Met...
http://www.wikihow.com/Drink-More-Water-...



</answer>

So you can fit into the jeans you want? So you can attract the opposite sex? MOTIVATION is what you need. Once you have a proper sleep schedule and time to exersize each day, learn to treat yourself with the same quantity of the right foods each day. Think about the results ! You can do it.

If you are looking to add some weight to your frame, then you are on the right track by not wanting fatty foods.  The basis of gaining healthy weight is to still eat the good foods. Eating more protein with your dinner.  Just little tweaks to the food you already eat (if healthy) is good.

<question>



Diet and Weight help?



I'm a 21 year old male, weighing in at around 164.  I have recently come down from about 186 which I did from changing my diet to a lot of grilled chicken / salads (without dressing) and fruits and veggies.  I eat a lot of apples and bananas for snacks and the chicken salads for meals.

Though I do see a big difference in my stomach size, its still flabby and still a gut.

I bike about 20 minutes to and from work every day.  And am constantly on my feet at work.  A lot of times lifting and moving things around.

Does any one have any advice?



</question>



<additional details>



I could start running if I have the energy (I work crazy hours)



Also, is eating like 6-8 apples and/or bananas  (if not more) a day really good, or not so good for me.  I work at Trader Joe's (A very healthy grocery store)  where when I get hungry I just grab an apple or banana and just eat one or two to hold me over until I can get my meal in.

<answer from>



beachgir...
Member since: 03 September 2008
Total points: 2653 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Diet & Fitness



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Yes, it sounds like you're doing a lot of the right things.  Your diet sounds healthy.  You might want to keep a food log for a week or two so that you can really analyze it and see if you can make any improvements anywhere.  You can print one out here:
http://www.easy-weightloss-tips.com/eat-...
and then after a week or two, compare it to this page to see if you're doing as well as you think.



Make sure that you aren't drinking sweet drinks, even diet soda.  Water should be your main source of hydration.  Sweet drinks play havoc with the mid-section.

Your activity sounds good too.  I would definitely keep up the crunches and I would add push ups.  They help your core too.  On this page:http://www.easy-weightloss-tips.com/targ...
you'll find some excellent abs/belly exercises that you can do at home with no special equipment.



Is running a possibility for you?  That would also help strengthen your core.



Other than that, I would just say, "be patient."  If you're doing all these things right, then it's only a matter of time before you'll see the results you want!  Good luck!!



</answer>

<answer from>



Guru of MSG
Member since: 31 August 2008
Total points: 124 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Please read this response in its entirety because what you don't know CAN hurt you.



Just make sure your baby avoids "processed free glutamate", a neurotoxic flavor enhancer that's both harmful and addictive to all humans, especially to babies. You won't be able to know in which foods to find it in because the FDA allows companies to let it be unlabled, so you, as a smart consumer, must know the ingredients and foods that contain it (see below).  MSG is just one of those many ingredients. FYI, consumption of processed free glutamate has been linked to Obesity, Migranes, Headaches, Learning Disabilities, Sleep Disorders and many more health problems that the health industry doesn't want you to know so that all those food/beverage corporations as well as your doctors will make big $$ while your health goes down.



The FDA claims that all glutamate (including processed free glutamate) is generally safe, but then why do independent studies prove that it's a toxic? Also, you'll see sodium and fat measured on labels even if there's none at all, but you won't see glutamate labeled and measured even though the food/beverage contains it.



The FDA also claims that all glutamate is natural, but, in reality, the processed free glutamate that's hidden is not the same glutamate that you'd find in natural, unprocessed foods such as tomatoes and mushrooms. So, because of the FDA's deceptive rules and regulation, you'll even find processed free glutamate in ingredients such as "natural flavor/flavors".



Yes, even some whole wheat breads contain that neurotoxin through the use of malted barley flour and yeast extract.

Check out http://www.msgtruth.com/avoid.htm for the complete list of ingredients/foods to avoid.
And check out http://www.msgmyth.com for more information about how harmful and addictive glutamate consumption can be to your health!

FYI, just by avoiding all those foods with hidden "processed free glutamate", I've lost at least 20 pound in 5 months.

If you stick to that kind of a truly smart diet, you'll not only save a lot of money (by being less hungry and going to the doctor less), but also become healthier!

And, don't forget: Knowledge is power!



Source(s):



www.msgmyth.com
www.msgtruth.com
www.truthinlabeling.org



</answer>

<question>

</question>



<additional details>

<answer from>



megmat
Member since: 13 July 2008
Total points: 320 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



The reading of 167/102 is rather high,more so considering that you are a young person.Your pressure reading would not actually alter your running performance but it would cause your blood pressure to go even higher.Exercise in the long term is good for lowering blood pressure but that is over a period of time as it strengthens the heart muscles.You cannot run a marathon and expect your pressure to be lower than when you started.Exercise causes both the heart rate and blood pressure to rise.
The reason that your blood pressure was raised could be that maybe you were nervous,i would see your GP about the blood pressure as it is rather high.I hope this has been of some help to you and good luck with your chosen career.

<answer from>



jd
Member since: 03 September 2008
Total points: 344 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



first let me start by telling you that I normally would never give this advice- however since you're trying to lose 5 lbs in a week I'd skip the exercise(just for that week though). Long bouts at the gym will only make you hungry and not to mention that muscle is more dense than fat and gaining muscle right now could counter act the weight loss you may experience from your diet. Especially if you normally don't work out-one week of excessive crunches will not do anything (except make you really sore)!  So,again, let me stress... this is not what i would suggest for long term weight loss, but for the time being it just might work.



</answer>

<answer from>



Teresa L
Member since: 05 May 2007
Total points: 200 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I am not an expert in weight loss, but have tried diet and exercise all my life. There are three major factors to be considered in order to assess your possibilities of losing those 5 pounds:
1) Your age. If you are young, you have a better chance to lose weight fast, If you are over 40 your chances are not that good.
2) The caloric value in your regular daily intake of food vs the amount of food you are proposing. If there is a big difference (i.e.you usually eat a higher-calorie dinner or lunch), you are at a good chance of losing it. But if you live on salads and fish....well...I'm guessing you may have to starve yourself...
3) The amount of exercise you are used to vs the amount of exercise you are willing to put out that week. If you walk 20-30 minutes a day, try increasing it to one hour, even split it, half in the morning and half in the evening...etc.
Other than that, I recommend watching out for those carbohidrates (particularly their glycemic index, since they make you feel hungry quickly) and increasing the amount of low-fat protein instead, which makes you feel full for a longer time and thus, better for avoiding snacking. What works for me with the night snacking business is slowly peeling and eating a whole orange or frozen mixed berries.
If you are in good condition and fairly fit, I would suggest jogging for intervals along with the walking. Jogging/Running slims you like nothing else (too bad I cant) Don't do any weight or resistance training this week, as it will make your muscles swollen and you will increase in weight. Good luck!!! You will look and feel wonderful...but be careful not to overdo it!!!



Source(s):



Good common sense and experience.



</answer>



<answer from>



ceaser
Member since: 15 August 2008
Total points: 497 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

good luck mate!

</answer>






<original file>index;_ylt=At.TsbYn9SMo7o9hZdmd0WsgBgxb5d5.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk47928.txt</current file name>



<category>



Health

</category>



<question from>



FrOst
Member since: 12 October 2007
Total points: 1643 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Stretch marks??



im obese,and im willing to do a very powerful diet and do alot of excercises,so the question is will the stretch marks on my stomach fade away,and is there any means to make it go away??



</question>



<answer from>



Amie
Member since: 30 May 2008
Total points: 804 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



There are several treatment options for stretch marks. The degree of success with any treatment will be impacted by your age, your skin tone and even your diet. Treatment options include:

Surgical methods
Dermabrasion, chemical peels, or laser surgery can be used to address unwanted stretch marks.

Lotions and creams
Over-the-counter stretch mark treatments are available. Ask your doctor to recommend one. And, if you are pregnant, discuss your concern with your doctor at the beginning of your pregnancy, before stretch marks develop, so that preventive treatment can be started.

Diet and exercise
Drink plenty of water. Adequate hydration keeps your skin soft and less likely to develop stretch marks. Caffeine can increase your risk of stretch marks. If you're stuck on your caffeinated coffee or tea, make sure you balance the fluids. Drink just as much—or more—water as you drink coffee, tea, or soda. Stretch marks can also result from nutritional deficiency. Be sure to consume foods that promote skin health: foods rich in zinc, such as nuts or fish; foods high in vitamins A and C, such as carrots and citrus fruits and milk; protein-rich foods, such as eggs.

It's best to be in the care of a surgeon or dermatologist. He or she can determine which treatment approach is best for you.



Source(s):



http://www.medicinenet.com/stretch_marks...
there is alot more info on this page



s



</answer>

<answer from>



loving_m...
Member since: 10 September 2008
Total points: 735 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes it is.  Your body uses lactose, which is an enzyme, to break down dairy when you eat it.  Biologically speaking we're not supposed to drink milk past infancy, especially not that of another species.  Some people's bodies produce lactose for their whole life, while others only produce so much.  The body can stop producing the enzyme, and then your body can't break down dairy and you become lactose intolerant.  You can try taking lactaid, or another supplement that contains lactose, which will allow you to eat dairy.  You just take it before you eat ice cream, or whatever.



There are a lot of dairy alternatives out there.  I mean, you can still eat dairy, it will just make you sick.  Personally I'll occasionally eat a piece of cheesecake or some Ben and Jerry's (looove Everything But The...) and just deal with the consequences.  I would go to the doctor first.  Like I said, it takes adjusting, but you can do it.  : )  Good luck!



</answer>



<answer from>



Cristine
Member since: 26 March 2008
Total points: 209 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes, i've been intolerant for a few months then i tried eating small amounts of dairy product,1 at a time until my stomach adjusts back to being lactose tolerant.



Source(s):



experience



</answer>

Health



Diet & Fitness



</category>



<question from>



Jack J
Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 163 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How can I get really defined muscles?



I would like to put on some lean muscle mass, but I dont want overbuldging muscle. How can I do that?(in regards with how should I work out, how many times a week, how many reps and sets.)



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



lots of calisthenics and cardio, combined with a diet of lean meats and vegetables in which you eat a small meal about every 2-3 hours while awake. The idea is to get your body burning fat, gaining/maintaining muscle. By eating many little meals throughout the day, you keep your bloodsugar stable and prevent your body from storing calories as fat.



</answer>

<answer>



Invite her to work out with you. If she does not want to, then suggest she get exercise in another form and that she should maintain a healthy diet. Make it clear to her in as nice a way as possible that her physical attractiveness is important to you. If she is unwilling to listen to you, then maybe she is not the right person for you.



Whatever you do, do it with sensitivity, try to assure her that she has no reason to lose her self-esteem -- you don't want her to develop an eating disorder.



</answer>

Yes, there is a nice way.
Actually, there are nice ways..



1. Tell her you're concerned about her health, too much is like too little, they both hurt, they both matter.



2. Remind her how to healthy.



3. Invite her to work out with you. You do it all the time, so bring her. You can also use this as bonding time with each other. "Compete" so that she'll try hard.



4. Go to a check up wit her, so that the doctor can tell her and not you, if you can't really come up with a line.



5. You can just be honest to her that you're losing interest because she's eating and eating. Don't be mean that you don't like fat girls.
Tell her that it's like the only thing she does, and you need other things. Tell her you do your best for her, and she just doesn't give anything back.



6. Ask help from her friends because no matter how they say it, they're cool. That's how girls are.



Just accept her. Be polite, but be honest.
Hope I helped. :]

<answer>



Do not tell her she's fat and do not bring atractiveness into it. She will probably get offended and become defesive/hurt.



Tell her that you care, not about her looks, but about her health. After all if she was healthy, she would be eating low-calorie meals and working out and would inevitably lose weight. Tell her that you are worried about her wellbeing, and that you are worried she may get sick, and you love her too much to see her hurt health. If you approach it this way, l think she might take it better and feel more positive about changing her behavior

Ally

</answer from>



<answer>



her feelings are going to get hurt and she's going to get pissed at you if you tell her flat-out that you want her to lose weight and you don't think she's attractive anymore (i mean, listen to how this would sound in your head - totally disrespectful, right?).



as her boyfriend - she's counting on you to help boost her self esteem, not totally damage it by doing what a lot of guys do - criticizing the way her body looks.



try to send small hints. for her birthday, or christmas - buy her a piece of clothing that she's wanted for a long time - but in a size too small. find some excuse to do some kind of active activity with her (although nothing that screams "weight loss!"). for example - go skiing, snowboarding, snowmobiling, hiking through the woods, etc.  instead of eating out, cook her a "romantic" (and coincidentally, healthy) meal. make comments about how you like when she takes care of her body, tell her that you think eating healthy & working out is sexy.



if none of this works, and you still want to date her - tell her that you wish she'd take better care of herself, tell her that you're concerned about her health. DON'T use the words "fat" or "lose weight" - i can guarantee that NO girl wants to hear those words from anyone, let alone her boyfriend. and if all else fails, what more can you do, but break up with her? you can't help that she doesn't know how to take care of herself & that you're not attracted to her any longer.
good luck & i hope things work out for you. =]



</answer>

<question from>



mezmura2...
Member since: 02 October 2008
Total points: 99 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How can you lose 100 pounds in a month when your in fifth grade?



i weigh 153 pounds and im in fifth grade and there is the pool party in a month and i need to lose weight and in a month please help!



</question>



<answer from>



Brookie
Member since: 14 May 2007
Total points: 1583 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Loosing 100 pounds in a month would be near impossible and very unhealthy, but loosing a smaller amount can be done!



Start by looking at your eating habits.
- Try replacing soda & sugar filled drinks with water.
- Cut out fast food, (It is so bad for you!)
- Try portioning your sizes



Then start by re-vamping your exercise routine.
- Try doing a workout in the morning and before you go to bed daily.
(This can be stretches, crunches, yoga . . .)
- Also, a few times a week fit in a quick jog, walk the dog, play basketball, just get moving for about an hour.



If you keep up a healthy menu and live an active lifestyle, you will not only loose weight, but also be overall healthier!



Hope this helps! Have a blast at the party!!



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks this shoud help and i will have a plast thanks



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



moonbird
Member since: 23 September 2008
Total points: 120 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Listen, if you lose that much weight, you will not only be seriously, deathly unhealthy, but you will be anorexic, too.



You see, if you starve yourself, your body goes into starvation mode, and you don't burn as many calories as fast. This means that when you start eating normal again, you will pack on the pounds faster than you can count.



True, you are a tad overweight, but at your age it is okay to be a little overweight as you are still growing.



I would aim at losing five pounds a month, and only losing 30-40 pounds in total.



Seriously. Please don't kill yourself over weight. It's not worth it. People will judge you by your personality, not your weight if they are good people.



Remember, you are a wonderful person, and if other people can't see that, it is their loss and you should ignore them. You are better than that.



Good luck.



</answer>



<answer from>



tenngal5...
Member since: 19 September 2008
Total points: 905 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



You don't say how tall you are, but the following should help:



The standard baseline is 100 lbs. at 5'. For every inch over 5', add 4 lbs. for a small frame, 5 lbs. for a medium frame and 6 lbs. for a large frame.



Check this website to see what your BMI is: http://www.nhlbisupport.com/bmi/. Just plug in your height and weight.



What I suggest is for you to concentrate on eating healthfully, limiting sweets and exercising in moderation. Avoiding "white" foods such as sugar, flour, potatoes and rice will help you lose weight pretty quickly. HOWEVER, if you go back to your old way of eating (junk and too much of it), you'll just regain it. Permanent weight loss can be successful only through permanent lifestyle change. You should probably take a good multi-vitamin and drink plenty of milk or take a calcium supplement. Avoid drinking a lot of soda pop since many of them, especially colas, contain phosphorous which leaches calcium out of your bones.



If you start RIGHT NOW, you may be able to lose 12-16 lbs. in 4 weeks, BUT NO CHEATING with the "white" foods!!



You'll look great at any weight if you put on a big smile, act confident, and be nice to everyone around you!!!



Good Luck!!



</answer>

<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I do triathlon training (spinning cycling, track and swim) and have been weight training for over 5 years. What i have found unbelievable helpful is taking Coenzyme Q10 and CLA (Conjugated Linoleic Acid, plant-derived). I have noticed a difference in my stamina and muscle development, as well as in my skin and hair. These can be taken safely, as long as you buy good quality products and follow the label indications. I get mine at my local GNC.



And please, don't even think about trying stuff like Red Line or Hydroxycut, they are really bad for your health.



</answer>

<question>



Best way to gain lean muscle mass...?



Ok as far as training goes..
I do 3 sets of 10-14 reps



and my work out schedule is as follows



day1: CHEST, BICEPS, ABS,



day2: REST
day3: TRICEPS, BACK, ABS
day4: REST
day5:LEGS, Lower Back, ABS, Shoulders
Day6-7 rest..



a 10 minute cardio work out before n after my weight training workout'



I'm 11% body fat



147 Lb at 5'6"
I started 4 Months ago at 132 lb



I would like to gain more muscle mass..but seem to be at a stump..



I tried increasing my weights but have trouble...



I have six meals a day, three of which are actually a protein (weight gainer), L-glutamine, creatine, vitamins, peptites..ect..



ANyone who actually trains have any recomendations on how to increase muscle mass.. without gaining fat..



</question>



<additional details>



I am one of those HARDGAINERS..



</additional details>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



sure, i am fortunately able to gain muscle mass quickly however i am not able to loose the weight. if you are really active i would suggest eating more carbs.



change your work out routines.- change the rotation of days, the types of lifts you do for the same muscle group. (i.e. i find for chest when i plateu doing bench i switch to doing dumbell bench press.)
cut the reps down for a few weeks, then increase the reps and decrese the weight.



simple changing of routines will add greatly to your progress. when you confuse the muscle it constantly has to adapt....



</answer>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>

All I can say is this:



Multiply your weight by 1.5



This number is the amount of grams of protein you need PER DAY.



Sometimes even I, a Mesomorph get STUCK at a particular weight, bodybuilders in progress call this a plateau, but if you continue doing all the right healthy things, and continue to work out, you will get over this plateau.



Gakic
Creakic
Leukic



These three supplements should get you over this.....if taken all together. You can buy these at a local GNC.

<answer from>



Ally
Member since: 25 August 2008
Total points: 980 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I love Bolthouse, Odwalla, and Naked brand fruit smoothies - you can find them at grocery & health food stores, and they usually are FILLED with protein, fruits, veggies, antioxidents, and other nutrients. Although, they definitely can get expensive (around 3-4 dollars for a small bottle), but the upside is that you don't have to buy any ingredients =].



If you decide to make your own smoothies - well, don't be afraid to experiment! My advice is to avoid putting dairy (milk/ice cream) in your shake - just because that can make it a bit unhealthier. Try adding nuts (for protein and good fats) and lots and lots of fresh fruit. Use as little sugar as possible to get the most out of the smoothie.
=]



Source(s):



http://www.vegfamily.com/vegan-pregnancy...



</answer>

<question from>

<question>



I'm an Ex-Bulimic, and I am in desperate need of help... ?



Hey guys,



I was bulimic/anorexic for about 2 years, to the point where I was even hospitalized due to it. I've had a few setbacks where I've almost fallen back into it time and again, but I always stopped myself before I could cause more damage to myself... (not saying I still do it, because I will never...ever.. resort to it again)  and I haven't resorted to it in about a year now.



Anyways, my question is:



What would be the best way for an ex-bulimic to lose weight? I've dieted, I've exercised excessively, I've taken vitamin supplements (B-complex, lipoic acic, acai, etc). But I still haven't seen one budge on the scale! And I've been doing this for months now! Does anyone have any advice for me before my mind goes nuts and convinces me to fall back into the vicious cycle of eating disorders? (which I never want to happen again, but its the only way that has ever worked for me unfortunately),  I could sure use it!



</question>

<question>



Is there a safe generic for anabolic steroids that would bring the same fast gains as A.S. With minimal risk?



Im a bodybuilder... Is there a generic out there for anabolic steroids



that could give me the same fast gains as steroids would with minimal risk???



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



Generics are just the same product not made by the original patent holder.



Pls do not consider using steroids for body building.  The natural look is far more attractive to women and a lot safer.  These steroids can cause some serious sides effects such as anger problems, osteoporosis, mood swings, sterility, which can be permanent and cancer.



Think very carefully.  You must balance your desire for a pumped up body against the dangers to your health and life.



Good luck



</answer>
